segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console

segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console

segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client and MED-V Management Console

segment.source: The following MED-V components are included in the client .msi package:
segment.target: The following MED-V components are included in the client .msi package:

segment.source: MED-V client—The MED-V software that must be installed on client computers for running MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: MED-V client—The MED-V software that must be installed on client computers for running MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: MED-V management console—The administrative tool that administrators can use to create and maintain images, MED-V workspaces, and policies.
segment.target: MED-V management console—The administrative tool that administrators can use to create and maintain images, MED-V workspaces, and policies.

segment.source: The MED-V management console and the MED-V client are both installed from the MED-V client .msi package.
segment.target: The MED-V management console and the MED-V client are both installed from the MED-V client .msi package.

segment.source: The MED-V client, however, can be installed independently without the MED-V management console by clearing the Install the MED-V Management application check box during installation.
segment.target: The MED-V client, however, can be installed independently without the MED-V management console by clearing the Install the MED-V Management application check box during installation.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The MED-V client and MED-V management console can only be installed on Windows 7-, Windows Vista-, and Windows XP-based computers.
segment.target: The MED-V client and MED-V management console can only be installed on Windows 7-, Windows Vista-, and Windows XP-based computers.

segment.source: They cannot be installed on server products.
segment.target: They cannot be installed on server products.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not install the MED-V client using the Windows runas command.
segment.target: Do not install the MED-V client using the Windows runas command.

segment.source: To install the MED-V client
segment.target: To install the MED-V client

segment.source: Log in as a user with local administrator rights on the local computer.
segment.target: Log in as a user with local administrator rights on the local computer.

segment.source: Run the MED-V .msi package.
segment.target: Run the MED-V .msi package.

segment.source: The MED-V .msi package is called MED-Vx.msi, where x is the version number.
segment.target: The MED-V .msi package is called MED-Vx.msi, where x is the version number.

segment.source: For example, MED-V1.0.65.msi.
segment.target: For example, MED-V1.0.65.msi.

segment.source: When the InstallShield Wizard Welcome screen appears, click Next.
segment.target: When the InstallShield Wizard Welcome screen appears, click Next.

segment.source: On the License Agreement screen, read the license agreement, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and click Next.
segment.target: On the License Agreement screen, read the license agreement, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and click Next.

segment.source: The Destination Folder screen appears, with the default installation folder displayed.
segment.target: The Destination Folder screen appears, with the default installation folder displayed.

segment.source: The default installation folder is the directory where the operating system is installed.
segment.target: The default installation folder is the directory where the operating system is installed.

segment.source: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change, and browse to an existing folder.
segment.target: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change, and browse to an existing folder.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the MED-V Settings screen, configure the MED-V installation as follows:
segment.target: On the MED-V Settings screen, configure the MED-V installation as follows:

segment.source: Select the Install the MED-V management application check box to include the management component in the installation.
segment.target: Select the Install the MED-V management application check box to include the management component in the installation.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Enterprise Desktop Virtualization administrators should install the MED-V management application.
segment.target: Enterprise Desktop Virtualization administrators should install the MED-V management application.

segment.source: This application is required for configuring desktop images and MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: This application is required for configuring desktop images and MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Select the Load MED-V when Windows starts check box to start MED-V automatically on startup.
segment.target: Select the Load MED-V when Windows starts check box to start MED-V automatically on startup.

segment.source: Select the Add a MED-V shortcut to my desktop check box to create a MED-V shortcut on your desktop.
segment.target: Select the Add a MED-V shortcut to my desktop check box to create a MED-V shortcut on your desktop.

segment.source: In the Server address field, type the server address.
segment.target: In the Server address field, type the server address.

segment.source: In the Server port field, type the server's port.
segment.target: In the Server port field, type the server's port.

segment.source: Select the Server requires encrypted connections (https) check box to work with https.
segment.target: Select the Server requires encrypted connections (https) check box to work with https.

segment.source: The default virtual machine images folder is displayed.
segment.target: The default virtual machine images folder is displayed.

segment.source: The default installation folder is %systemdrive%MED-V Images.
segment.target: The default installation folder is %systemdrive%MED-V Images.

segment.source: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change, and browse to an existing folder.
segment.target: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change, and browse to an existing folder.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Ready to Install the Program screen, click Install.
segment.target: On the Ready to Install the Program screen, click Install.

segment.source: The MED-V client installation starts.
segment.target: The MED-V client installation starts.

segment.source: This can take several minutes, and the screen might not display text.
segment.target: This can take several minutes, and the screen might not display text.

segment.source: During installation, several progress screens appear.
segment.target: During installation, several progress screens appear.

segment.source: If a message appears, follow the instructions provided.
segment.target: If a message appears, follow the instructions provided.

segment.source: Upon successful installation, the InstallShield Wizard Completed screen appears.
segment.target: Upon successful installation, the InstallShield Wizard Completed screen appears.

segment.source: Click Finish to close the wizard.
segment.target: Click Finish to close the wizard.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Supported Configurations
